targets.query: SELECT last("uptime") /86400 AS "days" FROM "autogen"."system" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null) ORDER BY time DESC
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("usage_iowait"), 1s) FROM "cpu" WHERE "host" =~ /^$server$/ AND "cpu" = 'cpu-total' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.description:
Connection number indicates sum of active, idle and idle in transaction  number. It is not only active session. 

If you want to check active session you can find an "Active Sessions" panel bellow.

targets.query: SELECT last("number_of_conn") AS "active" FROM "pg_stat_database_dtl" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/ AND "db" =~ /^$database$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Current Connection Number

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_difference(mean("checkpoints_req")) AS "Checkpoint Required", non_negative_difference(mean("checkpoints_timed")) AS "Checkpoint Timed", non_negative_difference(mean("checkpoints_timed")) AS "Checkpoint Timed" FROM "pg_stat_bgwriter" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.description:
Conflicts indicates number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery in this database. 

Deadlocks indicates number of deadlocks detected in this database

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_difference(mean("conflicts")) AS "conflicts", non_negative_difference(mean("deadlocks")) AS "deadlocks" FROM "pg_stat_database" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/ AND "db" =~ /^$database$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Conflicts/Deadlocks

targets.query: SELECT mean("datsize_in_kb") FROM "pg_stat_database_dtl" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/ AND "db" =~ /^$database$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT non_negative_difference(sum("calls")) FROM "pg_stat_statements" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/ AND "datname" =~ /^$database$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "datname" fill(linear)

SELECT "relname" AS "Relation Name", "bloat" AS "Bloat %", "wasted" AS "Wasted", "type" AS "Relation Type", "datname" AS "DB" FROM "bloats" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/ AND "datname" =~ /^$database$/ AND "time" >= 'now()-20s') AND $timeFilter

SELECT mean(running) as running, mean(blocked) as blocked, mean(sleeping) as sleeping, mean(stopped) as stopped, mean(zombies) as zombies, mean(paging) as paging, mean(unknown) as unknown FROM "processes" WHERE host =~ /$server$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host ORDER BY asc
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(context_switches),1s)as "context switches"  FROM "kernel" WHERE host =~ /$server$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host ORDER BY asc
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(processes_forked),1s) as forks FROM "kernel" WHERE "host" =~ /^$server$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host fill(null)
SELECT mean("file-max") as max FROM "linux_sysctl_fs" WHERE "host" =~ /^$server$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host fill(null)
SELECT mean("file-nr") as opened FROM "linux_sysctl_fs" WHERE "host" =~ /^$server$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host fill(null)

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM system WITH KEY=host
list.label: server
list.name: server
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM system WITH KEY=host

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "pg_stat_database" WITH KEY=db  WHERE host=~/$server/

list.name: database
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "pg_stat_database" WITH KEY=db  WHERE host=~/$server/

list.name: cpu
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM cpu WITH KEY=cpu WHERE host=~/$server/

list.label: disk
list.name: disk
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM disk WITH KEY=path  WHERE host=~/$server/
